newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Growth of Dutch temp sector slows in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Growth of Dutch temp sector slows in Q1.

text.p: The number of hours worked by temporary staff in the Netherlands rose 15 percent year-on-year in the first 1997 quarter, while temp agency turnover rose over 16 percent, the Dutch statistics office CBS said on Friday.
Temps worked a total of some 73 million hours during the first quarter of this year, equivalent to some 140,000 full-time jobs, CBS said.
In the year-ago period, temps occupied some 18,000 full-time jobs fewer than this year, it said.

Quarter-on-quarter growth has been decreasing since the first quarter of 1996, CBS said, adding that growth in seasonally adjusted full-time equivalent jobs occupied by temps slowed from 8,000 to 1,000 over the last four quarters.
It said temporary employment agencies' turnover rose to over two billion guilders in the first quarter.
Temporary employment is on the rise as the economy is doing well, but also because of companies' need for flexible personnel, the CBS said.
It said some 3.5 percent of all jobs in the Netherlands were filled by a temp in 1996.
